intro: Sebastiania corniculata f. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural collections.
